meanings.definition: Not willing to work with others or do what is asked.
meanings.sent1: The student was uncooperative during group projects, refusing to listen to his classmates.
meanings.sent2: The uncooperative attitude of the employee made it difficult for the team to complete the task.
meanings.sent3: The uncooperative cat refused to come down from the tree, even when offered treats.
meanings.sent4: The uncooperative puzzle piece just wouldn't fit, no matter how hard we tried.
meanings.sent5: Her uncooperative behavior caused tension among the group, leading to a lack of progress.

meanings.definition: Not helpful or willing to do what someone asks.
meanings.sent1: The uncooperative customer refused to provide any information, making it hard to assist them.
meanings.sent2: His uncooperative nature made it challenging to get him to follow instructions.
meanings.sent3: The uncooperative umbrella decided to flip inside out during the storm, leaving its owner soaked.
meanings.sent4: The uncooperative traffic light seemed to stay red for an eternity, causing frustration for drivers.
meanings.sent5: Dealing with an uncooperative computer program can be incredibly frustrating and time-consuming.
